verses.text: And it came to pass, when the king sat in his house , and the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* had given him rest round about from all his enemies ;
That the king said unto Nathan the prophet , See now, I dwell in an house of cedar , but the ark of God dwelleth within curtains.
And Nathan said to the king , Go , do all that \add is\add* in thine heart ; for the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* \add is\add* with thee. \p
¶ And it came to pass that night , that the word of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* came unto Nathan , saying ,
Go and tell my servant David , Thus saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, Shalt thou build me an house for me to dwell in ?\f + \fr 7.5 \ft my servant…: Heb. to my servant, to David\f*
Whereas I have not dwelt in \add any\add* house since the time that I brought up the children of Israel out of Egypt , even to this day , but have walked in a tent and in a tabernacle.

In all \add the places\add* wherein I have walked with all the children of Israel spake I a word with any of the tribes of Israel , whom I commanded to feed my people Israel , saying , Why build ye not me an house of cedar ?\f + \fr 7.7 \ft any of…: any of the judges\f*

Now therefore so shalt thou say unto my servant David , Thus saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* of hosts , I took thee from the sheepcote , from following the sheep , to be ruler over my people , over Israel :\f + \fr 7.8 \ft from following: Heb. from after\f*

And I was with thee whithersoever thou wentest , and have cut off all thine enemies out of thy sight , and have made thee a great name , like unto the name of the great \add men\add* that \add are\add* in the earth.\f + \fr 7.9 \ft out of…: Heb. from thy face\f*

Moreover I will appoint a place for my people Israel , and will plant them, that they may dwell in a place of their own, and move no more; neither shall the children of wickedness afflict them any more , as beforetime ,

And as since the time that I commanded judges \add to be\add* over my people Israel , and have caused thee to rest from all thine enemies. Also the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* telleth thee that he will make thee an house. \p
¶ And when thy days be fulfilled , and thou shalt sleep with thy fathers , I will set up thy seed after thee, which shall proceed out of thy bowels , and I will establish his kingdom.
He shall build an house for my name , and I will stablish the throne of his kingdom for ever.
I will be his father , and he shall be my son. If he commit iniquity , I will chasten him with the rod of men , and with the stripes of the children of men :
But my mercy shall not depart away from him, as I took \add it\add* from Saul , whom I put away before thee.
And thine house and thy kingdom shall be established for ever before thee: thy throne shall be established for ever.
According to all these words , and according to all this vision , so did Nathan speak unto David. \p

¶ Then went king David in, and sat before the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, and he said , Who \add am\add* I, O Lord 
d \+w GOD|strong="H3069"\+w*
d*? and what \add is\add* my house , that thou hast brought me hitherto ?

And this was yet a small thing in thy sight , O Lord 
d \+w GOD|strong="H3069"\+w*
d*; but thou hast spoken also of thy servant’s house for a great while to come. And \add is\add* this the manner of man , O Lord 
d \+w GOD|strong="H3069"\+w*
d*?  +  r 7.19  t manner: Heb. law *
And what can David say more unto thee? for thou, Lord \nd \+w GOD|strong="H3069"\+w*\nd*, knowest thy servant.
For thy word’s sake, and according to thine own heart , hast thou done all these great things , to make thy servant know \add them\add*.

Wherefore thou art great , O \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* God : for \add there is\add* none like thee, neither \add is there any\add* God beside thee, according to all that we have heard with our ears.

And what one nation in the earth \add is\add* like thy people , \add even\add* like Israel , whom God went to redeem for a people to himself, and to make him a name , and to do for you great things and terrible , for thy land , before thy people , which thou redeemedst to thee from Egypt , \add from\add* the nations and their gods ?
For thou hast confirmed to thyself thy people Israel \add to be\add* a people unto thee for ever : and thou, \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, art become their God.
And now, O \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* God , the word that thou hast spoken concerning thy servant , and concerning his house , establish \add it\add* for ever , and do as thou hast said.

And let thy name be magnified for ever , saying , The \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* of hosts \add is\add* the God over Israel : and let the house of thy servant David be established before thee.

For thou, O \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* of hosts , God of Israel , hast revealed to thy servant , saying , I will build thee an house : therefore hath thy servant found in his heart to pray this prayer unto thee.\f + \fr 7.27 \ft revealed: Heb. opened the ear\f*
And now, O Lord \nd \+w GOD|strong="H3069"\+w*\nd*, thou \add art\add* that God , and thy words be true , and thou hast promised this goodness unto thy servant :

Therefore now let it please thee to bless the house of thy servant , that it may continue for ever before thee: for thou, O Lord \nd \+w GOD|strong="H3069"\+w*\nd*, hast spoken \add it:\add* and with thy blessing let the house of thy servant be blessed for ever.\f + \fr 7.29 \ft let it…: Heb. be thou pleased and bless\f*
